questions.question: During what time period did Harriet Tubman live?
In what U.S. state was Harriet Tubman born?

choices.answer: Maryland
Virginia
Tennessee
Georgia

questions.question: Why did Harriet Tubman flee Maryland for Pennsylvania, leaving behind her husband?

choices.answer: She was afraid of being sold into slavery.
She was unhappy in her marriage.
She feared being sold further south.
She worried about angering her owners.
A train that ran like a subway from the South to the North
A secret network of people who guided slaves to freedom
A hidden place where people inspected and bought slaves
A group of Southern spies during the American Civil War

questions.question: What did Harriet Tubman accomplish as a “conductor” on the Underground Railroad?

choices.answer: She helped officials locate and arrest runaway slaves
She made sure the train ran smoothly from station to station
She worked to improve conditions for slaves on plantations
She led runaway slaves to safe houses and other “conductors”

questions.question: How many journeys did Harriet Tubman make on the Underground Railroad as a “conductor”?

choices.answer: Too many to be counted

questions.question: How did slaveowners respond to Harriet Tubman’s work on the Underground Railroad?

choices.answer: They sought to reward her for her brave actions.
They made fun of her and other “conductors.”
They searched for her and offered money for her capture.
They praised her work at town meetings and in newspapers.

questions.question: Harriet Tubman joined the abolitionists. What did they want to accomplish?

choices.answer: Catch runaway slaves
Pass the Fugitive Slave Act
Improve the conditions of the Underground Railroad
Ban slavery throughout the world

questions.question: How did Harriet Tubman serve the Union Army during the American Civil War?

choices.answer: She cooked for hungry and starving soldiers.
She nursed sick and injured soldiers.
She led raiding parties into Confederate territory.
All of the above.

questions.question: Why is Harriet Tubman known as the “Moses of her people”?

choices.answer: Like Moses, she was very religious.
Like Moses, she guided people to freedom.
Like Moses, she suffered greatly.
Like Moses, she made long, dangerous journeys.
